intro: Polymnia stenocarpha, commonly known as the narrow-fruit polymnia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often edible roots. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. Polymnia stenocarpha is often found in grassy areas and is adapted to thrive in dry, sandy soils.
